channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MF-MOS: A Motion-Focused Model for Moving Object Segmentation
item.description: Moving object segmentation (MOS) provides a reliable solution for detecting traffic participants and thus is of great interest in the autonomous driving field.

item.title: Breaking Free Transformer Models: Task-specific Context Attribution Promises Improved Generalizability Without Fine-tuning Pre-trained LLMs
item.description: We show that a linear transformation of the text representation from any transformer model using the task-specific concept operator results in a projection onto the latent concept space, referred to as context attribution in this paper.

item.title: One-Step Forward and Backtrack: Overcoming Zig-Zagging in Loss-Aware Quantization Training
item.description: During the gradient descent learning, a one-step forward search is designed to find the trial gradient of the next-step, which is adopted to adjust the gradient of current step towards the direction of fast convergence.

item.title: State Value Generation with Prompt Learning and Self-Training for Low-Resource Dialogue State Tracking
item.description: Experimental results on the MultiWOZ 2. 1 dataset show that our method which has only less than 1 billion parameters achieves state-of-the-art performance under the data ratio settings of 5%, 10%, and 25% when limited to models under 100 billion parameters.

item.title: Large Language Model Evaluation via Matrix Entropy
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have revolutionized the field of natural language processing, extending their strong capabilities into multi-modal domains.

item.title: Atlanta Scaled layouts from non-central panoramas
item.description: Our new pipeline aims to extract the boundaries of the structural lines of an indoor environment with a neural network and exploit the properties of non-central projection systems in a new geometrical processing to recover an scaled 3D layout.

item.title: Weak-to-Strong Jailbreaking on Large Language Models
item.description: Upon examining the jailbreaking vulnerability of aligned LLMs, we observe that the decoding distributions of jailbroken and aligned models differ only in the initial generations.

item.title: Zero-Shot Reinforcement Learning via Function Encoders
item.description: Although reinforcement learning (RL) can solve many challenging sequential decision making problems, achieving zero-shot transfer across related tasks remains a challenge.

item.title: SLIC: A Learned Image Codec Using Structure and Color
item.description: We propose the structure and color based learned image codec (SLIC) in which the task of compression is split into that of luminance and chrominance.

item.title: CRUD-RAG: A Comprehensive Chinese Benchmark for Retrieval-Augmented Generation of Large Language Models
item.description: For each of these CRUD categories, we have developed comprehensive datasets to evaluate the performance of RAG systems.

item.title: Multi-granularity Correspondence Learning from Long-term Noisy Videos
item.description: Existing video-language studies mainly focus on learning short video clips, leaving long-term temporal dependencies rarely explored due to over-high computational cost of modeling long videos.

item.title: Towards Assessing the Synthetic-to-Measured Adversarial Vulnerability of SAR ATR
item.description: Recently, there has been increasing concern about the vulnerability of deep neural network (DNN)-based synthetic aperture radar (SAR) automatic target recognition (ATR) to adversarial attacks, where a DNN could be easily deceived by clean input with imperceptible but aggressive perturbations.

item.title: Distinguishing Fictional Voices: a Study of Authorship Verification Models for Quotation Attribution
item.description: Recent approaches to automatically detect the speaker of an utterance of direct speech often disregard general information about characters in favor of local information found in the context, such as surrounding mentions of entities.

item.title: Taking Action Towards Graceful Interaction: The Effects of Performing Actions on Modelling Policies for Instruction Clarification Requests
item.description: Clarification requests are a mechanism to help solve communication problems, e. g. due to ambiguity or underspecification, in instruction-following interactions.

item.title: YOLO-World: Real-Time Open-Vocabulary Object Detection
item.description: The You Only Look Once (YOLO) series of detectors have established themselves as efficient and practical tools.

item.title: Making Parametric Anomaly Detection on Tabular Data Non-Parametric Again
item.description: Deep learning for tabular data has garnered increasing attention in recent years, yet employing deep models for structured data remains challenging.

item.title: Checkmating One, by Using Many: Combining Mixture of Experts with MCTS to Improve in Chess
item.description: This paper presents a new approach that integrates deep learning with computational chess, using both the Mixture of Experts (MoE) method and Monte-Carlo Tree Search (MCTS).

item.title: Taxonomy of Mathematical Plagiarism
item.description: Second, we analyze the best-performing approaches to detect plagiarism and mathematical content similarity on the newly established taxonomy.

item.title: H-SynEx: Using synthetic images and ultra-high resolution ex vivo MRI for hypothalamus subregion segmentation
item.description: Materials and Methods: We trained our deep learning method, H-synEx, with synthetic images derived from label maps built from ultra-high resolution ex vivo MRI scans, which enables finer-grained manual segmentation when compared with 1mm isometric in vivo images.

item.title: MuSc: Zero-Shot Industrial Anomaly Classification and Segmentation with Mutual Scoring of the Unlabeled Images
item.description: We reveal that the abundant normal and abnormal cues implicit in unlabeled test images can be exploited for anomaly determination, which is ignored by prior methods.

item.title: Gazetteer-Enhanced Bangla Named Entity Recognition with BanglaBERT Semantic Embeddings K-Means-Infused CRF Model
item.description: In this research, we explored the existing state of research in Bangla Named Entity Recognition.

item.title: MT-Ranker: Reference-free machine translation evaluation by inter-system ranking
item.description: Traditionally, Machine Translation (MT) Evaluation has been treated as a regression problem -- producing an absolute translation-quality score.

item.title: Non-central panorama indoor dataset
item.description: Omnidirectional images are one of the main sources of information for learning based scene understanding algorithms.

item.title: Traffic estimation in unobserved network locations using data-driven macroscopic models
item.description: This paper leverages macroscopic models and multi-source spatiotemporal data collected from automatic traffic counters and probe vehicles to accurately estimate traffic flow and travel time in links where these measurements are unavailable.

item.title: CPR++: Object Localization via Single Coarse Point Supervision
item.description: CPR reduces the semantic variance by selecting a semantic centre point in a neighbourhood region to replace the initial annotated point.

item.title: NormEnsembleXAI: Unveiling the Strengths and Weaknesses of XAI Ensemble Techniques
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive comparative analysis of explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) ensembling methods.

item.title: Evaluating ML-Based Anomaly Detection Across Datasets of Varied Integrity: A Case Study
item.description: In this study, we address the prevalent issue of data integrity in network traffic datasets, which are instrumental in developing machine learning (ML) models for anomaly detection.

item.title: Robust Prompt Optimization for Defending Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks
item.description: Despite advances in AI alignment, language models (LM) remain vulnerable to adversarial attacks or jailbreaking, in which adversaries modify input prompts to induce harmful behavior.

item.title: Morality is Non-Binary: Building a Pluralist Moral Sentence Embedding Space using Contrastive Learning
item.description: Our results show that a pluralist approach to morality can be captured in an embedding space.

item.title: Multivariate Beta Mixture Model: Probabilistic Clustering With Flexible Cluster Shapes
item.description: This paper introduces the multivariate beta mixture model (MBMM), a new probabilistic model for soft clustering.

item.title: Proactive Detection of Voice Cloning with Localized Watermarking
item.description: In the rapidly evolving field of speech generative models, there is a pressing need to ensure audio authenticity against the risks of voice cloning.

item.title: Planning, Creation, Usage: Benchmarking LLMs for Comprehensive Tool Utilization in Real-World Complex Scenarios
item.description: The recent trend of using Large Language Models (LLMs) as intelligent agents in real-world applications underscores the necessity for comprehensive evaluations of their capabilities, particularly in complex scenarios involving planning, creating, and using tools.

item.title: X-ray Image Generation as a Method of Performance Prediction for Real-Time Inspection: a Case Study
item.description: We show how a calibrated image generation model can be used to quantitatively evaluate the effect of the X-ray exposure time on the performance of the inspection system.

item.title: Channel Characterization of UAV-RIS-aided Systems with Adaptive Phase-shift Configuration
item.description: This letter considers a UAV aiding communication between a ground transmitter and a ground receiver in the presence of co-channel interference.

item.title: Personalized Differential Privacy for Ridge Regression
item.description: DP requires to specify a uniform privacy level $\varepsilon$ that expresses the maximum privacy loss that each data point in the entire dataset is willing to tolerate.

item.title: Layered and Staged Monte Carlo Tree Search for SMT Strategy Synthesis
item.description: Our method treats strategy synthesis as a sequential decision-making process, whose search tree corresponds to the strategy space, and employs MCTS to navigate this vast search space.

item.title: OptiState: State Estimation of Legged Robots using Gated Networks with Transformer-based Vision and Kalman Filtering
item.description: State estimation for legged robots is challenging due to their highly dynamic motion and limitations imposed by sensor accuracy.

item.title: Category-wise Fine-Tuning: Resisting Incorrect Pseudo-Labels in Multi-Label Image Classification with Partial Labels
item.description: Large-scale image datasets are often partially labeled, where only a few categories' labels are known for each image.

item.title: Causal Machine Learning for Cost-Effective Allocation of Development Aid
item.description: Then, we demonstrate our framework using real-world HIV data.

item.title: Prospects for inconsistency detection using large language models and sheaves
item.description: We demonstrate that large language models can produce reasonable numerical ratings of the logical consistency of claims.

item.title: OmniSCV: An Omnidirectional Synthetic Image Generator for Computer Vision
item.description: In this paper, we present a tool for generating datasets of omnidirectional images with semantic and depth information.

item.title: A fully differentiable model for unsupervised singing voice separation
item.description: A novel model was recently proposed by Schulze-Forster et al. in [1] for unsupervised music source separation.

item.title: PBSCSR: The Piano Bootleg Score Composer Style Recognition Dataset
item.description: To achieve this goal, we sample fixed-length bootleg score fragments from piano sheet music images on IMSLP.

item.title: History-Aware Conversational Dense Retrieval
item.description: To address the aforementioned issues, we propose a History-Aware Conversational Dense Retrieval (HAConvDR) system, which incorporates two ideas: context-denoised query reformulation and automatic mining of supervision signals based on the actual impact of historical turns.

item.title: ESPnet-SPK: full pipeline speaker embedding toolkit with reproducible recipes, self-supervised front-ends, and off-the-shelf models
item.description: First, we provide an open-source platform for researchers in the speaker recognition community to effortlessly build models.

item.title: Gradient-Based Language Model Red Teaming
item.description: Red teaming is a common strategy for identifying weaknesses in generative language models (LMs), where adversarial prompts are produced that trigger an LM to generate unsafe responses.

item.title: NNOSE: Nearest Neighbor Occupational Skill Extraction
item.description: The labor market is changing rapidly, prompting increased interest in the automatic extraction of occupational skills from text.

item.title: Augmenting Replay in World Models for Continual Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In continual RL, the environment of a reinforcement learning (RL) agent undergoes change.

item.title: Reviving Undersampling for Long-Tailed Learning
item.description: In this paper, we aim to enhance the accuracy of the worst-performing categories and utilize the harmonic mean and geometric mean to assess the model's performance.

item.title: TeenyTinyLlama: open-source tiny language models trained in Brazilian Portuguese
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have significantly advanced natural language processing, but their progress has yet to be equal across languages.
